website_summaries.verdict: Because the First Alert SA320CN uses two sensing technologies, it can detect smoldering fires as well as fire with flames. It uses AA batteries, which are more common to have on hand, which is another nice feature.
pros: Customer reviewers say installation of these alarms is very easy
Uses photoelectric and ionization smoke sensors
Uses two AA batteries instead of 9-volts
cons: AA type batteries may need replacing more often than 9-volts
Some customers report failures and common false alarms with some of these alarms after several months

customer_reviews.title: They all eventually go crazy with false alarms!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these from Amazon. After about 3 years, one started to go off like there's a fire when there wasn't. I bought another one to replace it just to save the hassle of mounting a new bracket. Then one by they all started doing the same thing, going off when there was no smoke or fire whatsoever. I kept replacing them with the same unit out of laziness. So far 4 out of the 6 original have been replaced. I'm should have switched to some other brand sooner. Today I got rid of all of them.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: In my experience about 30% of the photoelectric+ionization units die after a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought about 10 of these units. Unfortunately, after just over a year one by one they have gradually started to sound the alarm uncontrollably. Replacing the battery with a new one didn't help. I didn't want go through the hassle of calling for warranty so I ordered a replacement. By the time I got the replacement a new unit was sounding the alarm out of control. I expected the units to last up to 10 years, a year of functionality is just too short. The next unit to go berzerk will be replaced with a different brand of smoke alarm. I wish there were more options when looking for ionization units.
customer_reviews.author: mragm

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy false alarm
customer_reviews.text: Goes off on it's own when there isn't any smoke. I bought 2 of them and they both have this defect. Worst item I bought on Amazon in 2016
customer_reviews.author: Nun

customer_reviews.title: Two out of three stopped working before warranty was up ...
customer_reviews.text: Two out of three stopped working before warranty was up. Company did not honor warranty -- said I needed info from original packaging, and of course who keeps that?
customer_reviews.author: Nhi

customer_reviews.title: Broke under warranty, wanted more money to send new one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March of 2017. It has a TEN YEAR warranty. It started to malfunction In Sept of 2018.. Emitting 3 chirps randomly. Customer service at FirstAlert said that is an indication of malfunction. They would send me a new one. But they are charging me a fee to mail the replacement Will not purchase this brand again because their product failed to live up to the warranty and I should not have to pay anything to have it remedied.
customer_reviews.author: Kymm Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: This is driving me nuts!!! It's beeping ...
customer_reviews.text: This is driving me nuts!!! It's beeping from my shower steam that's at the end of the hall. I never had that problem with my old detector & they're in the same location. I'm surprised it's so sensitive because I tested it with smoke and it took a lot of smoke to set the alarm off.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Does not last 10 years
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these, two of the "10 year" batteries have already failed and you cannot replace them. One of them would not turn off at 3am, and to take a hammer to it to get the internal battery to disconnect. DO NOT BUY. purchase one with replaceable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Super sensitive!!
customer_reviews.text: These smoke/fire detectors are honestly the most annoying things ever. They go off at least once a day because they are so sensitive. I’ll plug my toaster in and put toast down and not even 1 minute later these stupid things are going off. There is no smoke, no fire, no heat, no smell, nothing that should make them go off as much as they do. I’ll turn my oven on to heat up and they’ll go off. But then we actually had a fire in our microwave and THEY DIDN’T GO OFF! When we actually needed them to work, they didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated and hopeful.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these units two days ago. Easy installation despite needlessly complex directions. Directions printed on a huge 2' x 2' fold out. Unfortunately no where in the very extensive instructions did it explain that upon installation completion, if three short chirps are heard every minute the unit is NOT GOOD, a dud, useless. Took me a couple emails and phone calls and battery changes and location changes over two days to find this out. Manufacturer referred me back to Amazon...who handled it to my satisfaction. Determining their effectiveness in detecting smoke remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Emeril

customer_reviews.title: Fire Inspector recommended
customer_reviews.text: We recently were awakened by our smoke alarm. Unbelievably, an empty bedroom was ON FIRE!!! My husband was able to put out the fire before the fire dept. arrived. With a First Alert extinguisher. Without that smoke alarm, we would have never known. The fire inspector recommends the dual sensor detectors. So, we got extras. The old one worked, it was dual sensor, too. Please, ALWAYS have one of these AND an extinguisher!
customer_reviews.author: kaydiddle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by the fact that the units I bought are ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed by the fact that the units I bought are not in factory packaging and the batteries were not in original packaging? Can I trust these smoke detectors? Are they new? How old are the batteries and are they new?? A lot of questions I do not want to be having to ask with a safety sensitive device such as a smoke detector!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing what 10 years will do to your smoke detectors
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to replacing the ancient smoke detectors around the house. It's amazing what 10 years will do to your smoke detectors! The testing procedure is clear cut and the design is very modern. I actually will be picking up 2 more of these (already bought 3 of them) as I missed a couple of locations that need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: joshhan

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 of these to replace all of the old units in the house. 3 months later, one of them started continuously chirping the alarm pattern. No smoke, no fire, no cooking, nothing. Replaced the batteries and it did the same thing a month later. Now it's AFTER the return period closed, and I'm stuck with a worthless, non-working smoke alarm. I see these kinds of reviews for many smoke alarms - both First Alert and Kidde. How the hell are we supposed to protect our families if they can't produce products that work? Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: GregInWNY

customer_reviews.title: False Alarms
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these smoke alarms. One for immediate use and a spare. After a few months, the smoke alarm went off for no apparent reason and sounded for 30 seconds or so and shut off. This happened one more time, after which time, I replaced it with the spare smoke alarm I had bought. Same thing happened a couple of months later. Bad batch?? I don't know, but I WILL NEVER TRUST MY LIFE TO FIRST ALERT SA320 AGAIN!! Use at your own risk!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Piece of s...
customer_reviews.text: When buying a product, one thinks that you are spending money in things you need. I can assure you you are better off not buying this piece of junk. It will use all your batteries in a month. I just purchased this back in June and I have put new batteries twice. It has woken us up in the middle of the night and have us false alarms during the day.
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: Love Dual-Sensor & Price - Hate Battery Door and ETL, Not UL
customer_reviews.text: • Installation was easy because there are many holes available on the mounting bracket so you can re-use your last detector's screws or have room for error when installing. • I love the idea of dual sensor that is battery operated vs. hard-wired. Have only had it a few days so cannot attest to false alarms or not. • BUT opening the battery compartment was difficult. Ridiculous pin to remove first. • And it is only ETL approved, not UL. Even though it appears from what I read online that UL and ETL are both what are called Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratories (NRTL). UL develops the testing standards and tests to them. ETL tests to UL standards.
customer_reviews.author: MSKM

customer_reviews.title: False alarms, I hope
customer_reviews.text: This thing periodically just starts beeping for no reason whatsoever that I can determine, this last happening at 3am. Ironically, the time I totally burned a dinner with smoke pouring out of the kitchen, the alarm was silent. Cannot trust it. Unfortunately it's too late to return it so money and assurance down the drain. I'll have to try again with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: djaybx

customer_reviews.title: 100% Useless.
customer_reviews.text: 100% Useless. Placed it near my kitchen. Toaster failed while I was in the bathroom and kitchen fills with smoke, not a peep from this POS, which had brand new batteries in it. And this one I only bought a few months ago to replace a previous First Alert model that had failed. I will never, ever buy a First Alert product again.
customer_reviews.author: Filmlover2008

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Not in original package so I can't tell whether this unit was new or used. Batteries were just rolling around in the box. The unit itself is flimsy. The battery compartment was hard to open and would not close all the way after opening it a second time. It did test ok when batteries went in first time but again is unusable because battery compartment does not now close. Beware "easy handling packaging." Not worth the trouble of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: OldnAchy

customer_reviews.title: ONLY ONE OUT OF THREE COMPLETE!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed 3 of these. First box complete with mounting hardware and batteries. Second box had batteries but NO mounting hardware. Third box had mounting hardware but NO batteries! Boxes were sealed from factory but only 1 of 3 was complete. POOR QUALITY CONTROL..HOPE THEY ACTUALLY WILL WORK IN CASE OF FIRE! Needed to get screws and batteries which made a simple installation a pain. Units tested OK per instructions but I still wonder if they will work if the folks in Mexico can't get more than 33% of units complete with all contents. NO, I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND FIRST ALERT BASED ON MY EXPERIENCE.
customer_reviews.author: Craig157

customer_reviews.title: it's a pain to install something like this and then not have it work
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Other reviewers said these eventually fail and just start beeping. It happened to me, too. Two out of five I installed in multiple rooms in my house failed in exactly the same way. I moved out of the house so can't vouch for the remaining ones. To amazon's credit, they refunded the purchase price without me having to mail it back. Still, it's a pain to install something like this and then not have it work.
customer_reviews.author: KMich

customer_reviews.title: Came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: Dual sensors are nice. Mounting bracket allows you to rotate the detector almost 180 degrees, so if you want it to "line up" with a wall, most likely you'll be able to do it. Manufacture date was important, since you need to replace very 10 years. Mine had a 9/2019 date. Comes with batteries, but unfortunately mine were dead. Detector was in bubble wrap inside a plain cardboard box, so don't expect retail packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Smoke detector arrived unboxed, manufacture date was September 2018
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this in April 2020. When I saw that the detector was in bubble wrap and not in its original packaging, I was suspicious. Then we checked the manufacture date, and it was September 2018. We don't know if this detector was previously used, returned, defective, or something else. But we can't afford to take a chance that it won't work. We also don't appreciate being sold something under false pretenses.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: False alarms in high humidity
customer_reviews.text: I have two, purchased at the same time. After two years both are failing and falsely activating in high humidity conditions (we do not have A/C). When it rains and the air is cool (i.e. high relative humidity) they go off every time. Of course, these conditions usually occur sometime in the wee hours of the morning. The problem is an overly sensitive ionization circuit; I'll be replacing with photoelectric-only detectors. If you're not familiar with the difference (and tradeoffs) between the two types of detectors, it may be worth a Google. This one is a dual-sensor model that uses both types, but the ionization sensor is just too finicky for high humidity.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: tested and found they were fine, placed them back in
customer_reviews.text: In use for about six months. My partner diligently cleans detectors and tests batteries twice a year at DST changes. To our surprise, this unit started chirping "low battery" two weeks after being cleaned and having its batteries tested for power level. Removed them, tested and found they were fine, placed them back in.... unit stopped chirping. The point? This unit appears to give faulty low battery warnings, intermittently. Leaves me wondering about its reliability.
customer_reviews.author: MonarchMom

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Reports Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is Consumer Reports top rated battery powered dual sensor smoke alarm. A bit over 2 years ago I bought two Kidde detectors that were at the time CR's favorites. One died after 7 months - the other at a bit over 2 years. I bought this First Alert with standard batteries in April 2015 and it's still going strong. I just recently bought the ten year battery version to replace the second dead Kidde.
customer_reviews.author: Camp RunamokTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: This item arrived out of retail package and was poorly ...
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived out of retail package and was poorly put together. I don't want to trust a returned smoke detector.
customer_reviews.author: gamer201

customer_reviews.title: Both First Alert SA3210s Over 1yr Old When Received
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two First Alert SA3210 Smoke Alarm (Dual-sensing 10yr battery) units on 10/25/2019. When I received them I found they both had a manufacturing date of October 17, 2018. They were over 1 year old before I received them. One of them had already been activated (i.e. the switch on the back was in the ON position.). They have an internal 10-year battery that cannot be replaced. As far as I know, the 10 year operating life of these units and/or their batteries started over 1 year ago - especially so for the one that was already on. I'm disappointed in with these units.
customer_reviews.author: Don G.

customer_reviews.title: 2/5 have failed in 18 months, cost $4 each for proper disposal
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 5-pack 18 months ago because "experts" recommended the dual photoelectric and ionization sensors, but I've had two fail (same as other reviewers) with constant chirping for no reason. First Alert replaced both at no charge without question, but my problem is that it costs $8 in postage to send the two smoke detector back to First Alert for proper disposal (because of the radioactive material in the product, my state requires consumers to mail "dead" alarms back to the manufacturer).
customer_reviews.author: Sam1

customer_reviews.title: Dual ionization provides the best protection
customer_reviews.text: Dual ionization should be the minimum standard for smoke detectors. This model is able to quickly alarm for both smoldering and quick blazing fire types. Easy to install and have yet to experience any problems with false alarms. A push of a button to check for proper functionality. Excellent ratings by an independent consumer testing organization. We have one in our living room, hallway, each bedroom, utility room and basement. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Roden

customer_reviews.title: "Smart" sensing microchip? :)
customer_reviews.text: Part of a "blurb" I read for this product was "The SA320CN's smart sensing microchip helps determine the difference between non-threatening conditions and real emergencies." WELLL.... It's not THAT "smart". I have it mounted on the wall beside a kitchen cabinet, (not even in direct site of the stove). It goes off when making (AND NOT BURNING) toast (and it's PLENTY loud)! Do I HATE this? Not so much. You can press the mute button and turn it off. I'd rather know it's actually "sensing"...but think it would be nice to "dial it down" just a tad! I have another one in the family room, (no smoker's in the house)...so I've yet to hear IT go off!
customer_reviews.author: RCP

customer_reviews.title: Top rated dual sensor Smoke & Fire Alarms
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these 10 year lithium battery, dual sensor smoke and fire alarms which were rated #1 by Consumer Reports. Installed easily and hopefully won't ever be needed. I find it very upsetting that the dual sensor alarms are not available in stores, and are only available on line, when they are rated the best for alerting you to fires and smoke which will save lives. They should be readily available in many stores. Please note that they have an inexpensive battery version of this smoke detector, but thanks to a new California law in July 2015 requiring 10 year batteries they are not available in California .
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Dual sensor = extra security
customer_reviews.text: First Alert has been making smoke alarms for many years and their products are very well designed & made. This model includes both ionization & photoelectric sensors to help ensure the alarm will sound quickly for either fast burning or smoky/smoldering fires. It comes with detailed instructions, is easy to install, and is plenty loud enough. It uses AA batteries which are a little cheaper than the 9V batteries many other smoke alarms use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Barry PDX

customer_reviews.title: False Alarms!
customer_reviews.text: Woke up to a false alarm in the middle of the night! Luckily I was home or my neighbor would have kicked in the door to save me and I'd have to replace a door as well! This thing went straight into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2-3 months. Consumer Reports fail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily because it was rated highly in a Consumer Reports but was soon surprised how quickly the cheap components corroded(?) or otherwise failed on me (We live in a moderate climate) and had to toss it after only a few months. Have since used a Kidde instead and have been happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: veritas

customer_reviews.title: Duo mode smoke detector. Purchased a replacement,  hope it reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for the same model which failed (one in six) in about a year after installation. I just wanted the duo detection mode & having matching detectors. I like the dual mode photo & Ionic. Maybe this will save a life someday. I would of liked this smoke/fire detector a lot more if it had a 10 year battery life, but changing the AA battery (not 9 volt) is not a game changer for me. The battery change only takes a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Tick

customer_reviews.title: Came with 1.5 years of use already on a 10 year battery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these smoke alarms because there are few dual detectors on the market. These have a 10 year battery so no changing batteries twice a year. But 3 out of 4 smoke alarms came with the battery turned on. Since the manufacture date was 1.5 years ago, the smoke detectors already have 1.5 years of use. I would not buy these again from a source where i could not see the manufacture date before purchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I've had three of these smoke/fire alarms and they all were a bust. Some had poor battery life so I had to keep installing batteries every few months. Others went off when there was no fire/smoke. I was NOT cooking, grilling, lighting candles, nor do I have a fireplace and the alarm would go off on more than one occasion. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 10+ year old smoke detectors with these. Within 6 months, I had nothing but issues. Between 6-12 months, all 6 I purchased started randomly going off. I replaced batteries and checked for dust. The batteries fixed it for a few months then they start again. Not to mention, it’s always when I’m dead asleep that go off! I was happier with my old smoke detectors that actually worked!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Halbert

customer_reviews.title: Although I receive the item on time and it did ...
customer_reviews.text: Although I receive the item on time and it did not look used it was not in the original packaging and it is expired
customer_reviews.author: MelissaSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Product package was not original and included a label with ...
customer_reviews.text: Product package was not original and included a label with a grammatical error. Decal on detector appeared poorly applied. Not sure if this is a legitimate product.Amazon does not accept returns on this.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M.

customer_reviews.title: ALARM Failed after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Like other people who purchased this product, it failed after one year. The alarm went off like there's a fire when there wasn't. The fire department verified that it is a faulty alarm. I should have read the reviews more carefully before I purchased the product. Being woke in the middle of the night with the sound of a fire alarm is very disturbing. First Alert should fix the defective products or stop selling them with the expectation that they will last for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Le Chat

customer_reviews.title: Good alarm, but some units prone to false alarm
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these to replace older alarms in our house. The dual-sensor feature was very important to me, and it works great; perhaps a little too good in fact! I've found that these alarms are prone to false alarm (due to dust, I believe) if I don't regularly blow them out with compressed air. Obviously would rather have them go off than not, but it is a bit disconcerting at 3am. This has happened with multiple units in a variety of operating areas (bedrooms, hallways, basement). Still using them, just added a little more time to my monthly maintenance routine around the house to air-dust them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: False alarms
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these and a couple of them get a lot of false alarms. By that I don't mean it goes off when cooking, blowing out candles, or whatnot. Rather, it simply goes off in the middle of the night with absolutely nothing going on. The false alarms don't seem to happen during the day. It makes for a pretty unpleasant time.
customer_reviews.author: horatio s.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: This detector stopped working in less than a year. I replaced the batteries and still it was going off when there was no smoke. The date on the back of the smoke alarm showed it was outdated even though I had owned it less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great concept.  Time will tell how well it performs.
customer_reviews.text: Our house had only one old, hard-wired detector that probably no longer worked. It was located two inches from a corner wall, which is not recommended for it to function properly. I bought four of these dual-sensor units with the 10 year battery. I installed one in each bedroom and one in the living room/ hall area just outside the bedroom area (according to location guidelins by the National Fire Protection Association). They've been installed for about 6 weeks now, with no false alarms. I'll update the review if any issues occur in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Powered by two AA batteries, not 10-year sealed battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smoke alarm by accident; I haven’t used it at all. I gave this product one star in order to alert a potential purchaser that the smoke alarm is powered by two AA batteries, and not the more-or-less standard 10-year sealed battery. This is a curious product. How long can a smoke alarm last with two AA batteries? You would be changing the batteries all the time.
customer_reviews.author: CompLit

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and installed this First Alert 6 months ago almost to the day. In the last 48 hours it has gone off twice. At 2pm and at 5am. Of course there was no fire or smoke. It is now a ticking alert bomb and is being replay today by another manufacturer. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: WARNING--Found out that it does not work when I needed it to!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a different smoke detector that went off every time I took a hot shower. Although I purchased it June 2018 I learned that it didn't work after a burner on my stove caught on fire, even though when I had previously tested it by pushing on the button and it indicated it was working. Just to be safe than sorry, I took a further step to test it after that by lighting 2 stick matches on fire only a foot from it. They produced black smoke that rose to the fire alarm. NO FIRE ALARM until 5 minutes later. Ummm... if it was really fire it would have been too late for me to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Like everyone else, they go haywire after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 to protect my new home and they all go off randomly when there isnt any dust, heat or humidity issues. I even tried using a DataVac to properly clean them out and nothing, they still wake me up several nights a week. Complete waste
customer_reviews.author: E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Easily installed, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Install easily (don't let the docs intimidate you, for residential use you don't need all the locking features). Being able to change out the batteries without dismounting the units is a great (if not long-overdue feature), feature. Dual detectors (optical and ionizing) detect smoldering and burning. Good value for the price; I replaced all four of my detectors with these and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: MGruson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have had it installed in a bedroom and the sitting-room for only four months. The batteries are still good. No false alarm. A First Alert smoke alarm of another model installed in my kitchen has sounded off the alarm two times when it detected burned food. So I trust the ones in the bedroom and the sitting-room work as well. I bought the First Alert smoke alarms to replace my old Kiddie smoke alarms which are smaller in size. I was so happy to find out that the base of the smoke alarm has holes designed to fit different distances between the two screws. Therefore, I could just use the old drill holes for installing the new smoke alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Pang

customer_reviews.title: Smoke detector made in 2018. Too old
customer_reviews.text: I received this smoke detector in the mail. It was made November 22, 2018. I tried to return it for a current model made in 2020 but the website does not allow exchanges or returns.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after 11 months of use. Alarm sounds continually ...
customer_reviews.text: Malfunctioned after 11 months of use, and 16 months from the date of manufacture. The alarm sounds continually. (I tried two sets of new batteries. Another detector placed in the same location does not sound. I followed the cleaning procedures recommended by First Alert Customer service.) I updated this review from 1 star to 2 stars because FirstAlert is sending a replacement. I am only giving two stars ("I don't like it") because it the product failed and I had to go through the process of getting it replaced. Model No. SA320.
customer_reviews.author: ES9

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Not returnable if problematic.  Chased the chirping defective detector
customer_reviews.text: After replacing the battery in every one of these that I bought a year ago and cleaning the sensors with compressed air, one of them went defective and would chirp setting off all of the detectors in the house randomly. Had to pull them down one at a time over the period of 2 weeks to get it figured out. Not terribly impressed with that. For the price, the quality is poor. Oh, and after ordering the replacement ones, found out they aren't returnable. Thank you Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: If you like being woken at 3 a.m. buy this
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Apparently it eats batteries because I am constantly changing them due to its chirping in the middle of the night every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installed 1/6/18. replaced  9/27/18.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor design of battery compartment, After 9 mounts of use and several false alarms and sporadic beeps I have replaced with a different brand. The battery compartment seems not to make contact, there is no way to adjust contacts etc.. to try to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Low battery chirping with new batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this product except that after three years it's begun its Low Battery Chirping when the batteries aren't even low. Of course it does this an hour before wake-up time which is especially aggravating. It's really a low temperature indicator. When the temperature gets down to about 64F in the house and the detector has soaked in that for a few hours it starts chirping. Second time in a week I've checked the batteries replacing them once. No improvement. Battery voltage 1.496V (not dead by a mile).
customer_reviews.author: Sighclops

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this alarm on November 4, 2018. Last week it started "chirping" to indicate low battery -- even though I had just replaced the batteries a month earlier. So I put in a brand new, just purchased, fresh set of batteries -- and within 24 hours it starting "chirping" again. What's the point of having a smoke/fire alarm if you have no confidence that it will actually work???
customer_reviews.author: C. Silva

customer_reviews.title: We purchased 3 of these. After less than 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these. After less than 2 years, one of them alarmed and wouldn't stop. We could not silence it until the batteries were removed. There was no smoke or fire,the other smoke detectors did not alarm, and the house has yet to burn down, so we are quite sure the device is faulty.The other 2 units still seem to be functioning properly, so hopefully no more middle of the night fire drills. We are going to try a different brand for a replacement and see if our luck changes.
customer_reviews.author: C K

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform
customer_reviews.text: I added the battery and did the weekly test. The alarm did not sound & there is no periodic flashing light. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen L.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: BETTER PROTECTION
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwired smoke protectors in my 13 year old house. Despite the hard wiring, they are always running out of battery at the most inconvenient times. I had replaced the one in the master bedroom several times, and always found it extremely difficult to get the battery back in correctly. I decided to replace the whole thing and, in reading reviews, decided that a dual sensor was the way to go. I was able to place this in a more reachable spot and give up on the hard wired on in that room completely. No more midnight alarms!
customer_reviews.author: Shopperdeluxe

customer_reviews.title: Arrived 18 months old
customer_reviews.text: The manufactured date on all of the purchased detectors was 18 months prior. Since the price of the units was not discounted from any other leading store, I was misled.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: not very effective
customer_reviews.text: My computer caught fire in the basement. Fortunately we could smell it because this smoke detector didn't make a peep. Will be replacing with something else.
customer_reviews.author: wildpack

customer_reviews.title: Not shipped in orginal packaging
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived in bubble wrap only, no original First Alert package. The stamp on the back says made in Nov. 2017. So since it arrived in Oct. only a 9 year plus 1 month life smoke alarm. I am wondering if that is why not in original package. Just put it up today; so will see how many false alarms if gives, which was the complaint of others. It was mounted in hallway of 2 upstairs bedrooms.
customer_reviews.author: KCB

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but failed in a few years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this less than 3 years ago. Randomly in the middle of the night the alarm went off. I pressed the test button and a few minutes later it went off again. I then changed the batteries and it's still going off. There's no way to stop it so I'm not sure if this is how it tells you it's life has ended so I'm just replacing it. I have 2 others that haven't had this happen yet. The location of this one is near a bathroom and I'm wondering if the steam eventually got the best of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden17

customer_reviews.title: I wanted it to go off if my food is burning and it took a little while but it actually worked with incense directly under it all others I've tested wouldn't go off if they were in a house full of smoke so I'm pleased with this one
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a smoke detector that would actually go off when there was a little smoke. I wanted it to go off if my food is burning and it took a little while but it actually worked with incense directly under it all others I've tested wouldn't go off if they were in a house full of smoke so I'm pleased with this one. I did some reading and it said look for the Dual sensors this one has it and it worked. If you want it not to go off when you're cooking and burning something moving it away from your kitchen but I just as soon not burn my house down cooking.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Defective and flimsy compared to past models
customer_reviews.text: Mine was defective. The test button only works sporadically. The "normal operations" indicator (green light) doesn't work at all. The drawer for inserting batteries is very hard to open and close. I tested the unit with fresh batteries and it still didn't work right. Very flimsy compared to previous First Alert smoke detectors I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Hampsteader

customer_reviews.title: only lasted 3 years...
customer_reviews.text: so much for the 10 year battery life...what a bummer. and if you're older and not able to deal with the continuous alarm going off at 3 a.m., heaven help you. this is major case of misrepresentation.
customer_reviews.author: book dragon

customer_reviews.title: Failed After Almost 10 months!
customer_reviews.text: Sitting here this evening and this alarm, with a battery that is supposed to last ten years is apparently malfunctioning. The alarm is going off repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No More False Alarms
customer_reviews.text: If you want a detector that doesn't give numerous false alarms this might be the one for you. I have had several different styles of other brands that constantly gave false alarms when cooking or even burning a candle. This model hasn't given a false alarm in a couple months of use. Easy to install, relatively easy to replace batteries, decent value .
customer_reviews.author: RDSWY4

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and provides 2 methods for fire/smoke detection. Note that it has no carbon monoxide detector, if that is desired, and cannot communicate with other detectors to sound an alarm throughout the house. That feature seems important, but available alarms of that type, which communicate wirelessly, are often prone to interference and false alarms from electric appliances. I installed 5 of these, one in each bedroom, as insisted by a building inspector in on another project, since it is now mandated by the current code.
customer_reviews.author: Alphonse Greybeard

customer_reviews.title: Random beeps from the get-go
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace one that began randomly beeping and continued to do so even after installing new batteries. Put new batteries, the ones recommended on the product page, in this guy as soon as I got it. Hasn't been up 24 hours and the random beeps begin; my poor dog is scared out of his mind. Come to find out, these things can't be returned. Waste of a lot of money, and I have no idea where to turn for a working smoke alarm. Argh!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Three Years - First Alert Replaced the Unit
customer_reviews.text: Lasted three years and started going off like there was smoke. The batteries were at 1.47v so I replaced them. Still continued to go off like there was smoke. I vacuumed the vents. Still continued to go off. I called First Alert and they replaced if for $6 to cover the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this purchase. New alkaline batteries last about a month, then unit beeps low battery. I tried some lithium AA cells and they lasted much longer, about 4 months, but at the cost of the lithium's, its not worth it. I tried Costco, Kodak and Duracell brand batteries. All have the same short life in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Designer

customer_reviews.title: Started chirping like a dead battery even with brand new batteries
customer_reviews.text: Started chirping like a dead battery even with brand new batteries. Called First Alert and they had me reset with a total power drain. At this point seems to have worked but they did say they would replace it if it happens again. Unit was 1 year & 1 month old when the problem started.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Went off when I burned something in the oven.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Replaced an older smoke detector near our kitchen... those one has already gone off a few times due to smokey cooking incidents. Maybe not the best choice if it's going right near your kitchen and you have a tendency to burn food or cook at high heats often as it will go off, but a great option for other areas of the house. It obviously works for detecting smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Fail, 2 years 5 months, then fail.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted almost through two sets of batteries (inclusive of the original), then lost its stupid electronic mind. Environmental conditions were the most benign possible in a normal house. Makes one wonder whether it would have actually worked when needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Here's to better sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace our old dual sensor Kidde alarms that had outlived their recommended lifespan. Even though the mounting bracket was a different size, it has two sets of holes for the mounting screws, and we didn't have to drill new holes to fit the new bracket. That was nice. What I'm really excited is the ten year battery life. Ten years without replacing batteries or waking up at three a.m. to low battery chirps. To me, the extra cost for the ten year battery was worth it. I'd spend more than that replacing batteries every six months over that time, anyway. And we'll sleep better too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has the dual sensor to detect both ...
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully, we haven't had much experience with this alarm but thus far it seems to be working well. It went off once when I burned something in the kitchen, so we know it works! I like that it has the dual sensor to detect both fire particles and smoke, as these are the safest kind of smoke alarms. Did lots of research before purchasing, and this was the most affordable product that senses both.
customer_reviews.author: E. Glanville

customer_reviews.title: Easily installs in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to install and simple to use smoke alarm. It includes the mounting screws so you just need to provide the tools. You need a 3/16" drill bit, drill, screw driver, pencil and hammer and chair to stand on. It took about 20 minutes to install including reading the instructions. The instructions are clear and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H. Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great dual sensor smoke/fire detctor until a 10-yr. battery died in about a year.
customer_reviews.text: The dual sensors gives peace of mind for the protection offered. Reasonably-priced, promptly delivered, appropriately packed. Update 21 FEB 2020 After one year of use BOTH units are chirping - 10 yr. sealed batteries that don't last as long as a decent 9V battery - and it is not a one-off. Both started chirping within 3 days of each other. I would strongly recommend going with a standard replaceable type batter smoke detector and NOT buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: gbdusmc

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first SA320CN; all of the Sa320CN units I have purchased seem to have a one year window of flawless operation then they start to act up. I have kept them clean and they are installed in the correct locations; but right around a year they start to freak out. I really want the dual sensor feature and have had success with First Alert in the past. Perplexed at the moment...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doing what it's supposed to, I guess...
customer_reviews.text: I'm never sure how to rate these? I mean, the equipment arrived, I installed it, I'm assuming it's working... Tests okay... Do I verify and improve my product review if when my house catches fire and burns down and it wakes me and saves my life, or...? Just got it, so can't speak for the battery life... But a specific consumer magazine rated it highest, so that's what I went with!! Sorry, hope that helps!?
customer_reviews.author: LZL C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent alarm!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this about a month, so can't comment on long term good or bad news--yet. It installed on the plate that held another brand's detector--one that died via going off at 3 AM (smoke detectors always have their false alarms when people are sleeping!). Anyway...lot of plusses on this one. Uses AA batteries, which we keep lots of around here, and there's a handy battery drawer for these. So when it needs new batteries, won't have to disassemble this. Dual sensor means it helps protect against both smoldering and flaming fires. Price is decent, and it came quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Kuttner

customer_reviews.title: High failure rate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed 6 of these units less than a year ago, and already one of them has failed. Normally I would have grumbled a bit, and then I'd have ordered a replacement. But after reading of other customer's unacceptably high failure rates, I can see the writing on the wall. So I will now be looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Landin

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: A few minutes ago a pot full of sugar water we were making for hummingbirds, boiled over and started smoking profusely. This smoke detector sensed the smoke and alerted us. Another First Alert product, 0827B, located upstairs, did NOT detect the smoke. I whole heartedly recommend this SA320CN smoke detector. I just bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Bad Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Batteries included were not new. Too weak from age. Had to replace them with new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bought two, one died after a year's use
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it died. The battery tray? Anyway, it started to cheep/tweet, so I replaced the batteries. Nada, nothing, nichts. It appears that the act of merely opening the battery tray and replacing the batteries somehow ruined the unit?
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: False alarms after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: We had the same problem with false alarms after 2 years that the other reviewers have noted. Try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: JAY B

customer_reviews.title: Works as tested and looks good to boot
customer_reviews.text: Replaced all our smoke detectors once we found out that they are *most likely* useless after 10+ years of service. These are unobtrusive and connected into the existing screw holes. Tossed out the old and in with the new. The dual sensor sold us. Zero false alarms after two months. Hope to the good Lord we never have to hear them for real but very glad to have them on every floor and in every room. Have CO sensors throughout the house as well. Peace of mind for half a case of Guinness? I'll take that any day.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Johns

customer_reviews.title: Like throwing away your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these in August of 2019. Two of the four malfunctioned within a week of each other. I should have given the negative reviews more weight; what an utter waste of money. Will replace with a NON First Alert product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: Long Life Reliability
customer_reviews.text: These 10-year battery dual-detectors are cost effective over their life-span versus the cost buying batteries every 6 months for the same time period. The dual-sensor capability for both large and small smoke particulate (photo and ionization detection) provides better home safety protection because it will detect both smoldering and flaming fires. The detector mounting plate is configured to adapt to the screw mounting pattern of nearly any previously installed detector, regardless of manufacturer, much easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for old alarm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these because the dual-sensor provides an extra level of safety. Needed battery-only for an older home that was not wired for smoke alarms. The mounting bracket made it easy to re-use the screw holes from an older alarm. How well does it work? I don't know, and I hope I never hear the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Dogcatcher

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the highest rated smoke detectors on the market, according to Consumer Reports and other sources. This is the DUAL SENSOR type, the kind you want. If you aren't sure what a dual sensor is, look it up online...not all smoke detectors are created equal. I have 5 of these in my house and my girlfriends house has 4. So far, no malfunctions etc. They are definitely pricier than the single sensor models, but honestly...how much is the safety of your family worth? If you ever are unfortunate enough to have a house fire, the higher price you paid will be a complete non factor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P IuseAmazon2much

customer_reviews.title: 66% Fail Rate Within 1 Year!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these due to the dual sensor design and at first I was happy, but one year later two of the three have failed. Like many other reviewers have stated, I started getting false alarms for no apparent reason. I've installed new batteries numerous times but they would still alarm constantly. I'm not waiting for the third to fail, will be replacing all with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product makes false alarms. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a batch of three and had each fail by false alarm after a few months. Bought one more, silly me, and had it fail with a false alarm THE NIGHT WE INSTALLED IT. Now I have no fire alarm and no way to get a refund. Do not buy this product. It does not work. It is consistently faulty. It fails.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Green

customer_reviews.title: One of 3 units failed out of box. Amazon quickly responded.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. One OK, the other did the low battery beep every minute. Batteries were OK. Sent it back. Got a replacement one overnight from Amazon. It seems to be OK so far. +++ for Amazon. RE a question I wanted to know, the units I received were manufactured Nov 2016. So they will be good to Nov 2026 before the radioactive part fails. (10 years since manufacture). IE they are not old or obsolete units.
customer_reviews.author: David  S.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate smoke alarm with explanation of possible false alarms 🚨
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of complaints about these but I fail to see why. Mine is 2 years old and fine. Performance to perfection. What more can you ask for in a safety device. I will buy these again without hesitation. What some people do not know is these are sensitive to several factors. Fresh paint in some colors can trigger them. Crumbs burning in an unclean toaster can too. Lastly, spiders and dust. Just blow them out with air and they will work fine. These cost more at local box stores, so I’m buying another on Amazon from Amazon. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: I HATE SMOKE ALARMS!
customer_reviews.text: Thought after reading up on smoke alarms, and now on my third one from various companies, that this might be the one. But it's not, but it is the first to go off from boiling water! I have to take it off the wall and put it in the other room every time I cook, not convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Marc

product_meta.title: First Alert Dual-Sensor Smoke and Fire Alarm, Battery Powered, Frustration-Free Packaging, SA320CN
product_meta.description: Style:Dual Sensing Smoke AlarmWhile all smoke alarms are designed to detect smoke, different sensing technologies react differently to certain types of fires. This alarm makes use of both ionization and photoelectric sensors to offer the earliest possible warning regardless of the type of fire. Sometimes a fire can smolder for hours before erupting into flames. Photoelectric Sensing Technology is more sensitive than Ionization Sensing Technology at detecting these sorts of smoldering fires, like those caused by cigarettes burning in couches or bedding. Other fires erupt into flames quickly, like kitchen grease fires or fires fueled by paper burning in a wastebasket. Ionization Sensing Technology is generally more sensitive than Photoelectric Sensing Technology at detecting these sorts of flaming fires.
feature_bullets: Help keep your family safe with this battery operated smoke alarm; It requires no rewiring for installation and provides continuous monitoring even if there's a power failure
Equipped with both a photoelectric and ionization sensor to quickly detect both fast burning, and smoldering fires
Single test/silence button lets you easily check alarm function and mute false alarms; Use Polaroid AA batteries for best results
Loud 85 decibel siren sounds to alert you to danger
To ensure complete protection make sure to place one on each level of your home and in each bedroom
First Alert has been the most trusted brand in home safety since launching the first residential smoke alarm in 1958 (Based on a First Alert brand trust survey in February 2018)

specifications.Included Components: First Alert Sa320Cn Dual Sensor Battery-Powered Smoke And Fire Alarm, 2-Aa Batteries
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,702 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
